comments_content.body:
Review data changes at [tx/08f4b383-7d47-4030-b9d0-9b7398728641][1]

When this PR is merged, this transaction will be applied.

[1]: https://hub.wrgl.co/@ipno/r/data/tx/08f4b383-7d47-4030-b9d0-9b7398728641
So strange, looking at the transaction I don't see the `use-of-force` table change. Did you see the change on local?
Hmm. Yes. Changes are present on local.

Review data changes at [tx/0bd0f0dc-0226-4f71-a93a-2a6e6527ee47][1]

When this PR is merged, this transaction will be applied.

[1]: https://hub.wrgl.co/@ipno/r/data/tx/0bd0f0dc-0226-4f71-a93a-2a6e6527ee47
I added `datavalid.yml` as common prerequisite and it seems to trigger re-run correctly now. However there is an error with wrgl pull so hold on.

Review data changes at [tx/894babe5-c8c4-4e1e-825b-cf9aa091bf9a][1]

When this PR is merged, this transaction will be applied.

[1]: https://hub.wrgl.co/@ipno/r/data/tx/894babe5-c8c4-4e1e-825b-cf9aa091bf9a
@ayyubibrahimi there are only 2% of the uids populated in use_of_force. Please investigate.

I see the issue. We decided to split out the `fuse/use_of_force.csv` table into three: `fuse/use_of_force.csv`, `fuse/uof_officers.csv`, `fuse/uof_citizens.csv`. 

Only `fuse/uof_officers.csv` contains `uid`, but these three tables can be joined on `uof_uid`.

 Kenner PD, the only other agency with a uof table, has not yet been split. Once Kenner PD is split, all uids will live in the `fuse/uof_officers.csv` table. I will do it now.

Review data changes at [tx/a8dbcbd1-1fdc-4ddc-944b-5a0f0af91959][1]

When this PR is merged, this transaction will be applied.

[1]: https://hub.wrgl.co/@ipno/r/data/tx/a8dbcbd1-1fdc-4ddc-944b-5a0f0af91959

Hmm, why does the `use-of-force-officers` table have `uof_uid` as the primary key? There can be multiple `uid` per `uof_uid` so I think `use-of-force-officers` should have both `uof_uid` and `uid` as the primary key.
Agreed. Thanks. I've made the change.
